intro: Physanthyllis, commonly known as the false mallow, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its showy, often pink or purple flowers that bloom in clusters. The plants typically have palmate leaves with lobes that are often hairy or pubescent. Physanthyllis species are native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. They are often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks.
